summary: Harold A. Rose was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications from October 1977, November 1977, and May 1978, listing Rose's name, position, and salary during those periods. While the specific role of Harold A. Rose within the HSCA is not detailed in these documents, the payroll certifications confirm his employment during the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Harold A. Rose's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of his contribution are not specified in the provided documents.
